sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: The exp function is used to find e to the power r, where e is the natural base and r is the parameter to exp. For example, exp (0) returns 1 and exp (1) returns the value of e.
sections.mdown_content: The **exp** function is used to find e to the power r, where e is the natural base and r is the parameter to **exp**. For example, **exp** (0) returns 1 and **exp** (1) returns the value of e.

sections.title: Example
code:
for i : 1 .. 100
            put "Exponential of ", i, " is ", exp (i)
        end for
sections.raw_content: This program prints out the exponential values of 1, 2, 3, … up to 100.
sections.mdown_content: This program prints out the exponential values of 1, 2, 3, Â… up to 100.

sections.title: See also
sections.raw_content:
ln (natural logarithm function).

See also predefined unit Math.
